title: Open Science Retreat 2024
description:
Here you can find all the artefacts/outputs from the 2nd edition of the Open Science Retreat (#OSR24NL), from the 25th to the 29th of March, 2024. This took place in Schoorl, the Netherlands. During this week people from various disciplines came together to share knowledge, experiences, and best practices related to open science.


In order to add your work to this collection:

  1. Publish your artefacts/outputs directly on ResearchEquals or another platform that provides you with a DOI (e.g., Zenodo, Figshare)
  2. Submit your DOI to be included. This can be done in two ways:
  • Directly submit your DOIs on the right while logged in
  • Share your DOI on the #Unconference-teamwork channel on Mattermost

module.title: Persona non grata in open infrastructure
module.description: At the Open Science Retreat 2024, a group came together to discuss persona non grata (anti-persona's) and how they may risk harmful behavior in open infrastructure. Persona non grata are "people you probably donâ€™t want in your product or service, but who are likely to find their way in anyway." This module should not be considered an encompassing mapping, but a start for further discussions.

workspace.bio: My research focuses on how the publishing system can facilitate improved quality of scholarly research. In particular, my research  explores modular publishing systems that break a research project into its building blocks. These building blocks are then sharing continuously and in chronological order, to provide a more accurate depiction of the research journey. I am currently director of the organization Liberate Science GmbH to implement this research finding into practice, and develop the practical use of it within a diverse set of research communities.

My research focuses on how the publishing system can facilitate improved quality of scholarly research. In particular, my research  explores modular publishing systems that break a research project into its building blocks. These building blocks are then sharing continuously and in chronological order, to provide a more accurate depiction of the research journey. I am currently director of the organization Liberate Science GmbH to implement this research finding into practice, and develop the practical use of it within a diverse set of research communities.

Assistant prof @ Leiden University, the Netherlands. Researcher, teacher and Open Science Community manager to further responsible research methods and research(er) integrity in Psychology, Neuroscience and beyond. Board chair of the network of Dutch Open Science Communities (OSC-NL); community manager @OSCLeiden. #Meta-science #OpenScience #Replication
